reference.title: bodydiv
reference.shortdesc: The <bodydiv> element is used to contain informal blocks of information within the body of a topic. The bodydiv element is specifically designed to be a grouping element, without any explicit semantics, other than to organize subsets of content into logical groups that are not intended or should not be contained as a topic. As such, it does not contain an explicit title to avoid enabling the creation of deeply nested content that would otherwise be written as separate topics. Content that requires a title should use a section element or a nested topic.

refbody.section: The bodydiv element may nest itself, which means that it may be used by specializers to create structured information within a body. Another common use case for the bodydiv element is to group a sequence of related elements for reuse, so that another topic may reference the entire set with a single conref attribute.
